sections.heading: tax; deficiency; notice.Sixty days after the date on which it was mailed, or one hundred fifty days if the taxpayer is outside the United States, a notice of proposed assessment of a deficiency shall constitute a final assessment of the amount of tax specified together with interest, additions to ta
sections.text: tax; deficiency; notice.Sixty days after the date on which it was mailed, or one hundred fifty days if the taxpayer is outside the United States, a notice of proposed assessment of a deficiency shall constitute a final assessment of the amount of tax specified together with interest, additions to tax, and penalties except only for such amounts as to which the taxpayer has filed a protest with the Tax Commissioner.SourceLaws 1967, c. 487, ยง 77, p. 1605;Laws 1993, LB 345, ยง 63;Laws 1994, LB 977, ยง 16;Laws 2008, LB914, ยง 10.
